title: Difference between Props and states
content: The main difference between props and state is that props are passed down to a component from its parent component and are read-only, whereas state is managed within a component and can be updated using the `setState` method.

title: How does useState really work?
content: `useState` is a hook in React that allows functional components to have local state. It returns an array with two elements - the current state and a function to update that state.

title: Beside data load work in which work does useEffect used?
content: `useEffect` is a hook in React used for managing side effects. In addition to data loading, it can be used for tasks such as setting up event listeners, updating the document title, and subscribing to services.

title: How does React work?
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It works by using a virtual DOM to efficiently update and render components based on changes in state or props, minimizing unnecessary updates and improving performance.
